intro: Schizopepon bicirrhosus, commonly known as the two-ribbed sponge gourd, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its distinctive, warty, and ridged fruit. The plant produces large, yellow to orange fruits that are used in various culinary and medicinal applications. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while the vines are trailing and can grow up to several meters in length. Schizopepon bicirrhosus thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
